abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Frederick Douglass and Sojourner Truth are subjects of coming books that analyze their shared habit of commissioning photos; Enduring Truths: Sojourner’s Shadows and Substance by Darcy Grimaldo Grigsby and Picturing Frederick Douglass: An Illustrated Biography of the Nineteenth Century’s Most Photographed American by John Stauffer, Zoe Trodd and Celeste-Marie Bernier explore how former slaves both used their likenesses to further abolition and foster African-American pride.
lead_paragraph: Douglass and Truth, two of the most famous 19th-century African-Americans, commissioned formal works of themselves as part of their public relations strategies.

headline.main: New Books Analyze the Photographs of Frederick Douglass and Sojourner Truth
headline.print_headline: The Stories Behind Two Famous Faces in American History

snippet: Douglass and Truth, two of the most famous 19th-century African-Americans, commissioned formal works of themselves as part of their public relations strategies.
